title: Nord Stream Pipelines Have Stopped Leaking After Earlier Damage
description: Both European and Russian leaders have said that ruptures discovered undersea were an act of sabotage.

title: Bolsonaro outperforms the polls as Brazil’s election appears headed to a runoff.
Ukrainian Troops Hunt Demoralized Russian Stragglers in Seized City
description: A major Russian newspaper said the Russian troops, facing defeat in Lyman, had fled with “empty eyes” after barely escaping with their lives.

title: Nine NATO nations express support for Ukraine’s membership bid.
Your Monday Briefing: Indonesia’s Stadium Tragedy
description: Plus Brazil votes in national elections and China wrestles with Covid fatigue.

title: If Bolsonaro disputes a loss, some supporters are ready to take to the streets.
Putin’s Claims to Donetsk Are News To Some Residents of Newly-Liberated Lyman
description: Russia’s president decreed on Friday that four regions of Ukraine including Donetsk, where Lyman is located, would be absorbed into Russia.

title: Hurricane Orlene Expected to Hit Western Mexico by Monday
description: Orlene, a Category 3 storm, could bring as much as 14 inches of rain to some areas, forecasters said.

title: In Quebec, the Independence Movement Gives Way to a New Nationalism
description: In Monday’s election, residents of a town that was once a stronghold of the independence movement are expected to back the province’s popular premier, who has embraced a nationalism based on French Québécois identity.

title: A soldier and civilian are treated side-by-side at a field hospital in the south.
Fans Focus on Police After More Than 100 Die at Indonesian Soccer Match
description: Witnesses said officers fired tear gas indiscriminately into the stands, causing a stampede that led to at least 125 deaths.

title: Chinese #MeToo Case Settled in U.S. Court
description: The case, involving a billionaire entrepreneur, riveted observers in China, where women alleging sexual wrongdoing by powerful men are often pilloried, silenced or both.

title: Burkina Faso’s Self-Proclaimed Leader Tries to Reassure Country
description: Capt. Ibrahim Traoré, who announced a coup on Friday, was greeted by dozens of protesters in the capital, Ouagadougou. Many of them said they wanted Russia to help the country tackle a security crisis.

title: While deaths are rare at soccer games, aggressive policing can light a match.
description: This is not the first time this year that the sport has had to confront the reality that tragedies often result from failures of policing, security and crowd management.

title: Live Updates: Polls open in Brazil in Most Consequential Elections in Decades
description: The far-right president, Jair Bolsonaro has questioned the integrity of Sunday’s election and trails in polls to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, a leftist and former president, who was imprisoned amid a corruption scandal.

title: Families Share Stories of Death and Survival After Indonesian Stadium Disaster
description: Dozens of people sat on mats with bags of fruit and bottles of water waiting for their relatives’ name to be called.

title: Zelensky says Russia’s retreat shows its annexation moves are a ‘farce.’
How the U.K. Finance Minister Came to Ignore Finance Experts
description: Kwasi Kwarteng, the chancellor of the Exchequer, faces widespread anger over the tax cuts he and Liz Truss have pushed, but their history of dismissing the economic establishment goes back years.

title: A choice between two heavyweights
description: Brazil votes for president today. Jack Nicas, the bureau chief there, explains what’s at stake.

title: Indonesian Fan Still Hears ‘Voices Screaming’ After Match
description: One witness said most of the victims were people trapped in the stands, not those on the field. Without tear gas “there would have not been any casualties,” he said.

title: Leicester Tensions Have Roots in India
description: Violent confrontations in Leicester have prompted soul searching in an area long heralded as a success story of diversity and integration among its large Indian diaspora.

title: The U.N. nuclear agency calls for the release of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant’s director general.
Putin’s nuclear threats stir growing alarm in Washington.
description: In a gathering Cold War atmosphere, American officials are gaming out responses should Russia resort to battlefield nuclear weapons.

title: Indonesian Soccer Tragedy Is Latest in History of Stadium Disasters
description: These events have prompted major changes. But fatal tramplings still occur, with more than 150 killed in Indonesia on Saturday.

title: Iran Protests Fueled by Sickly Economy
description: The country’s long economic decline has been one of the main forces sending Iranians into the streets over the past two weeks to demand change.

title: Live Updates: Death Toll Rises After Stampede at Indonesian Soccer Match
description: After a home team loss, fans ran onto the field and were confronted by the police, who used tear gas. In the panic that ensued, many were trampled, leaving at least 150 people dead.

title: Zelensky Says Russian Retreat Shows Annexation Is a ‘Farce’
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky said that his forces will recapture more towns in the Donbas region soon after they took parts of Lyman.

title: Gazprom halts gas supplies to Italy.
description: The Italian gas provider Eni said that the Russian monopoly did not deliver the natural gas it had booked for Saturday.

title: Ukraine Forces Retake Lyman, a Strategic City, as Russians Retreat
description: Russia’s withdrawal from the city comes one day after Moscow illegally annexed the surrounding region.

title: Here’s why Russia’s retreat from Lyman matters.
